result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion for Stay of Entry of Judgment, Stipulated Conditions for Dismissal, and Order for Stay of Entry of Judgment and Dismissal

2:04 PM 
Defendant Cody Lee Bevins in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Cody Lee Bevins.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angel  Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Angel re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Defendant is advised of their voting rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Angel joins in the motion.

Court Orders: Sentence withheld DPA for a Period of 18 Months 
-See motion for complete list of conditions.

Defendant Cody Lee Bevins in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Cody Lee Bevins.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant stands "MUTE".
"NOT GUILTY" entered on all counts.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:23 PM
 Defendant Cody Lee Bevins in court. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.

Court Orders: $500.00 Signature bond
-No alcohol, controlled subastance or establishments
-No acts/threats towards Ashley Bevins

Court informs the defendant of their right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Ashley Bevins.
